title: Israel joins US-led 'Pax Silica' initiative to cooperate on securing AI supply chains
description: PM's economic adviser touts 'mark of distinction for Israel,' as US, seven allies launch effort to 'shape a new, sustainable economic order for the age of artificial intelligence'
content:
Israel on Friday joined the US’s Pax Silica Initiative to cooperate on supply chains for artificial intelligence at an international conference in Washington.

title: Slop for dinner: How AI recipes took over the internet
description: Food bloggers are seeing their traffic – and revenue – dip as home cooks are lured by chatbots and artificial intelligence. The results can be less than appetising.
content: Eb Gargano has been writing recipes online long enough to anticipate the seasonal rhythms of her web traffic. The Easy Peasy Foodie creator can predict when readers will begin searching for her stress-free turkey instructions, or when her Christmas c... [487 chars]

title: Nvidia considers increasing H200 chip output due to robust China demand
description: NVIDIA has told Chinese clients it is evaluating adding production capacity for its powerful H200 artificial intelligence (AI) chips after orders exceeded its current output level, according to two sources briefed on the matter.
content:
NVIDIA has told Chinese clients it is evaluating adding production capacity for its powerful H200 artificial intelligence (AI) chips after orders exceeded its current output level, according to two sources briefed on the matter.

title: Mental health concerns rise as rapid AI adoption outpaces safeguards
description: Artificial intelligence (AI) became a defining part of daily life in 2025, but its fast-growing presence is now raising concerns among clinicians, researchers and public-health agencies who say the pace of adoption is taking a measurable toll on mental well-being. Studies reviewed by The Manila Times show that while AI offers potential benefits for early diagnosis and therapy support, unregulated use in workplaces, social media and personal decision-making is fueling rising anxiety, burnout and emotional dependency.
content: Artificial intelligence (AI) became a defining part of daily life in 2025, but its fast-growing presence is now raising concerns among clinicians, researchers and public-health agencies who say the pace of adoption is taking a measurable toll on ment... [6007 chars]

title: How AI is changing the way buyers evaluate suppliers
description: DURING my recent talk on “Digitalization and Artificial Intelligence for Philippine Exporters” under Philexport, I recalled a recent experience. A Filipino supplier shared how a potential buyer quickly evaluated her catalog with the help of an AI tool. The software scanned her product descriptions, checked for consistency and clarity, and highlighted details that needed improvement. What once required hours of manual review now took only a few minutes. For the buyer, this was simply the normal way of doing business today.

title: 'Homeopathy Can Cure Cancer If Diagnosed Early, Lifestyle Changes Are Key Post-COVID': Dr Farokh J Master
description: The Free Press Journal (FPJ) conducted an exclusive interview with the globally acclaimed homeopathic physician, academician, researcher, and cancer specialist, Dr. Farokh J Master. The discussion centered on the increasing incidence of cancer, the health fallout observed post-COVID-19, the scope of treatment within homeopathy, and the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the practice.

title: Investment Boom: From Google To Microsoft, Why Tech Companies Are Investing In India
description: India is emerging as a key global hub for artificial intelligence investment, with some of the world’s most powerful technology companies turning their attention to the country. Industry heavyweights are committing significant resources, drawn by India’s young demographic and its expanding digital ecosystem.
